page.title: 07Housing & Historic Buildings
page.content: The majority of{housing}is{owner- {occupied,}although some is Council- owned. Some houses are fairly modern but most are 50 years old or more, many having been modernised. Some{historic buildings}such as Morley's, Shiprods, Ewhurst Manor and several Sussex barns, date back to the 15th century, and others such as Chestham, Shermanbury Place and Shermanbury Church are also of interest. The residential character of housing is rapidly changing; with the increase in size of farms and reduced labour force, many farm houses and cottages have been sold as non- agricultural residences. Wymarks has been converted to an {Old People's Home}and Shermanbury Grange is a special school for 12 to 16 year olds run by West Sussex County Council.
